text: Asaphodes abrogata is a moth of the family Geometridae. It is endemic to New Zealand. It was first described by Francis Walker in 1862 using a specimen collected by P. Earl in Waikouaiti. The type specimen of this species is held at the Natural History Museum. ==Distribution== This species can be found in the central North Island as well as the South Island. ==Host plant== Plantago coronopus Larvae have been reared on Plantago species including Plantago cornopus. ==References== ==External links== * Specimens held at the Auckland Museum. Category:Moths described in 1862 Category:Moths of New Zealand Category:Larentiinae Category:Endemic fauna of New Zealand Category:Waikouaiti
title: Asaphodes abrogata
